definition: to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: The once powerful figures have also disappeared from the scene one after another.
sentences.chinese: 那些烜赫一时的人物也一个个销声匿迹了。

sentences.english: And yet the anger and turmoil of that period never entirely drained away.
sentences.chinese: 但那个时期爆发的怒火和动荡从未完全销声匿迹。

sentences.english: The fashion industry would die like an insect in autumn.
sentences.chinese: 时装业将会像秋后的昆虫一样销声匿迹。

sentences.english: E. g. 6: During the two previous centuries musical styles went in one era and out of another.
sentences.chinese: 在前两个世纪，音乐风格时髦一阵，又很快销声匿迹。

sentences.english: The rumour had to disappear before facts.
sentences.chinese: 在事实面前谣言只得销声匿迹。

sentences.english: Onece the orbs nearby fall into the black hole, they will disappear forever.
sentences.chinese: 附近的天体一旦落入黑洞，就销声匿迹，永无踪影。

definition: to be eradicated/to vanish/extinct/to break off relations
to retire (from society, esp. from politics)/to vanish
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
(of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
lit. lay down the flag and still the drums (idiom); fig. to cease/to give in
to achieve fame among one's contemporaries (idiom); temporary or local celebrity
